text: Saul disobeyed God's command through Samuel because

options.A: he feared the people and obeyed their voice
options.B: the people wanted to desert him
options.C: he was misled by the people
options.D: Samuel did not come early for the sacrifice

explanation:
Saul disobeyed God's command because he feared the people's opinion and chose to listen to them rather than fully obey God's instructions. He allowed the people to keep the best of the livestock instead of destroying everything, as God had commanded.
1 Samuel 15: 24 (RSV) says:
And Saul said to Samuel, "I have sinned; for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD and your words, because I feared the people and obeyed their voice."

text: Joseph's foresight as a leader was exemplified in his

options.A: storing food for the seven years of famine
options.B: service to Portiphar, an officer of Pharoah
options.C: managing the house of Pharoah very well
options.D: forgiving his brothers for selling him into slavery

explanation:
Joseph's foresight as a leader was demonstrated in his ability to interpret Pharaoh's dream about the seven years of plenty followed by seven years of famine (Genesis 41:28-36, RSV). He advised Pharaoh to store surplus food during the years of abundance so that Egypt would have enough during the years of famine. This strategic planning saved Egypt and surrounding nations from starvation.
OptionsB, C, and Dhighlight Joseph's other virtues—his faithfulness, administrative skills, and forgiveness—but they do not  demonstrate his foresight in leadership. Therefore,A is the most appropriate answer.

text: One important fact that Mary brought out in Jesus miracle of changing water to wine is that she

options.A: had a deep insight of her son and his abilities
options.B: was a sister of the bridegroom
options.D: must intercede for a miracle to occur

explanation:
The transformation of water into wine at the Marriage at Cana or Wedding at Cana is the first miracle attributed to Jesus in the Gospel of John. In the Gospel account, Jesus, his mother and his disciples are invited to a wedding, and when the wine runs out, Jesus delivers a sign of his glory by turning water into wine. Mary recognized the abilities of Jesus doing the impossible, that was why she took the case to him and told everyone to obey and do as he instructs them.
Bible ref: John 2:1-11
